summary: Email chain between Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding discovery issues in Maxwell's criminal case. The defense raises concerns about missing attachments, metadata anomalies on files from Epstein's devices, and logistical problems delivering discovery to Maxwell in prison.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP representing Ghislaine Maxwell, raising discovery issues with the prosecution regarding missing attachments, metadata problems, and delivery of discovery materials to Maxwell in prison.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Defense attorney cc'd on the discovery issues email from Christian Everdell, indicating involvement in Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Defense attorney cc'd on the discovery issues email from Christian Everdell, indicating involvement in Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Defense attorney cc'd on the discovery issues email from Christian Everdell, indicating involvement in Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case, referenced as the defense's client who is in prison and having difficulty accessing discovery materials on disks due to prison computer limitations.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the source of electronic documents extracted from his devices, which are part of the discovery materials in the Maxwell case.

connections.description: Everdell is communicating discovery issues on behalf of his client, Ghislaine Maxwell, and is seeking to facilitate delivery of discovery materials to her in prison.
Pagliuca is cc'd on the discovery email as part of Maxwell's defense team.
Menninger is cc'd on the discovery email as part of Maxwell's defense team.
Sternheim is cc'd on the discovery email as part of Maxwell's defense team.
The discovery materials include files extracted from Epstein's devices, indicating their connection in the underlying criminal investigation.
Both are listed as defense attorneys on the same team communicating with the prosecution.

events.title: Discovery Issues Meeting Scheduled
events.description: Email exchange scheduling a meeting for March 31, 2021, to discuss discovery production issues in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Metadata Anomaly Date
events.description: Reference point for metadata issues where files from Epstein's devices show 'date created' or 'date last modified' dates in July 2020 or later, after device seizure.

events.title: SDNY005 Production
events.description: A specific discovery production on October 20, 2020, containing videos from SDFL or PBPD investigations that were produced without proper metadata load files.

events.title: SDNY011 Production
events.description: A specific discovery production on November 9, 2020, containing files in native form with load files but lacking CART numbers and having September 2020 dates.

keyFacts: Defense attorneys for Ghislaine Maxwell raised significant discovery issues, including over 109,000 emails produced without attachments and over 110,000 electronic documents from Epstein's devices with metadata showing 'date created' or 'date last modified' dates in July 2020 or later.
Ghislaine Maxwell was in prison and unable to read discovery disks on her laptop, requiring use of a prison computer which could not read some files, creating logistical hurdles for her defense.

The discovery included over 6,500 photographs in native format without CART numbers and with 'date created' dates after July 2019, and over 460 audio/visual files with similar metadata issues from various productions (SDNY GM SUPP, SDNY005, SDNY011).
The defense requested metadata overlays with original metadata for files with anomalous dates and sought clarification on a gap in production numbers between SDNY_GM_02742044 and 2742183.

The correspondence reveals the scale of digital evidence in the case, referencing specific CART numbers and production batches from investigations by SDNY, SDFL (Southern District of Florida), and PBPD (Palm Beach Police Department).
